revised_title: Mammalian Retinae: Alpha Ganglion Cells and Brisk-Transient Receptive Fields
tldr: The authors examined alpha ganglion cells in the retinas of 21 mammalian species, finding that these cells have a consistent morphology and are present in all species studied. Alpha cells have the largest somata and large dendritic fields, and they are stratified into inner and outer subpopulations. These cells are associated with brisk-transient or Y-receptive fields, suggesting that this physiological system is a basic feature of placental mammalian retinas.
